title: Intracorneal haemorrhage.
summary: In the vascularized cornea of a 63-year-old woman a haematoma developed which was so large that pupillary block resulted. Evacuation of the haematoma restored the form of the cornea and normalized the intraocular pressure. ...
abstract: In the vascularized cornea of a 63-year-old woman a haematoma developed which was so large that pupillary block resulted. Evacuation of the haematoma restored the form of the cornea and normalized the intraocular pressure. For the restoration of vision a transplantation was necessary.
